title: Slow-Cooker Chicken Chow Mein
directions: In 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in oil about 5 minutes, turning once, until brown.

Spray 3 1/2- to 6-quart slow cooker with cooking spray. In slow cooker, place carrots, celery, onion, garlic and water chestnuts; top with chicken. In small bowl, mix broth, soy sauce and gingerroot; pour over chicken. Cover; cook on Low heat setting 6 to 8 hours.
In small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth; stir into chicken mixture. Stir in mushrooms and pea pods. Increase heat setting to High. Cover; cook 15 minutes longer. Serve over noodles.
ingredients: 8 boneless skinless chicken thighs (about 1 1/2 lb)*, trimmed of excess fat, cut into 1-inch pieces Save $
2 medium carrots, sliced diagonally (1 cup) Save $
2 medium stalks celery, coarsely chopped (1 cup) Save $
1 can (8 oz) sliced water chestnuts, drained Save $
1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms (3 oz) Save $
1 cup snow pea pods (4 oz) Save $
Chow mein noodles, if desired Save $
